required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Dietary Supplement Tauroursodeoxycholic Acid on Vascular Function
clinical_study.official_title: Targeting Endoplasmic Reticulum Stress to Correct Vascular Insulin Resistance and Glycemic Dysregulation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the present study is to determine if use of dietary supplement tauroursodeoxycholic acid enhances insulin-stimulated leg blood flow and glucose disposal.

detailed_description.textblock: The notion that cellular stress lowers insulin-induced vasodilation is largely founded on ex vivo studies and experiments in rodents. However, it remains unknown if maintenance of cellular function with the use of dietary supplement tauroursodeoxycholic acid enhances vascular function in humans. The investigators test the hypothesis that daily administration of this dietary supplement enhances vascular function, particularly, insulin-stimulated leg blood flow and glucose disposal.

study_design_info.masking_description: Participants are not told which are placebo or tauroursodeoxycholic acid capsules

primary_outcome.time_frame: Once at 4 weeks after the start of placebo and once at 4 weeks after the start of tauroursodeoxycholic acid
primary_outcome.description: Blood flow response during insulin clamp

primary_outcome.time_frame: Once at 4 weeks after the start of placebo and once at 4 weeks after the start of tauroursodeoxycholic acid
Once at 4 weeks after the start of placebo and once at 4 weeks after the start of tauroursodeoxycholic acid
primary_outcome.description: Glucose disposal rate during insulin clamp

primary_outcome.time_frame: Once at 4 weeks after the start of placebo and once at 4 weeks after the start of tauroursodeoxycholic acid
primary_outcome.description: Glucose response to an oral glucose tolerance test

arm_group.description: Taking daily placebo capsules for 4 weeks
Taking tauroursodeoxycholic acid (1750 mg/day) capsules for 4 weeks

intervention.description: Taking tauroursodeoxycholic acid (1750 mg/day) capsules for 4 weeks.
Taking daily placebo capsules for 4 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 2 diabetes diagnosed by primary physician
- Body mass index less then 43 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Recent weight gain or loss (>5% body weight in the last 3 months)
- Pregnancy
- Consumption of >14 alcoholic beverages per week
- Changes in the medication use or dose within the last 3 months
- Known cardiovascular or pulmonary disease
- Taking medication for advanced retinopathy or neuropathy
- Taking prescription anticoagulants
- Nicotine use
